p: C. albicans is a polymorphic organism adopting different forms (pseudohyphae, or hyphae) [ 6]. The blastospore form is associated with the commensal carrier state [ 7], while the hyphae form was associated with the yeast pathogenesis [ 5]. C. albicans invasion involves enzymes such as secreted aspartyl proteinases ( SAPs) to degrade the host proteins and invade tissues and organs [ 8].
